text.name: sys_description
text.text: The PC-98 is a line of Japanese computers created by NEC in 1982. The base model features a 5Mhz CPU, 128KB of RAM and VGA display 8 color output. In 1992, this was upgraded to a full 256 colors. The last model features a Pentium CPU, and the line would be discontinued sometime in 2000. There are thousands of games exclusive to the PC-98 including RPGs, action games, and the prolific D≈çjin-scene games. Despite having far less processing power than the FM-Towns and X68000, Japanese developers flocked to the PC-98 due to its widespread adoption (particularly from businesses).
